She had to live inside her massive mansion for all of her life and never got to go outside. Thanks to her parents being rich, she has everything she ever wanted, but all she wants to do is go outside one day and make a friend, and not having to be homeschooled all the time and alone. When her parents go out for several months for their work with little time to talk or hang out with their daughter, the couple decided to create a giant robot using state of the art technology that would act as Haruka's protector, nanny, friend, etc. Soon came born Leumya, the Protection Bot. Haruka awoke with her mask on. The filter kept the air out allowing her to breath. She already hated today, the mask itself reminded her that she was a freak. That she'd never be loved, etc. This was often her mindset.

"Good morning Mistress." She heard Leumya's voice in her head. Leumya was outside sitting on her knees. Haruka could see her from the window. Leumya was always so bright and cheerful. "Good morning..." Haruka mumbled softly. Leumya smiled. She knew her mistress was depressed but she had an idea. After breakfast which was fed through a tube Haruka went over to Leumya's controls. "I hope you don't mind me taking control..." Leumya didn't have a choice but Haruka considered Leumya to be her friend.

"Of course not M'lady but..." She now had a massive grin. "Why look through the monitor on your desk when you can see through my eyes?"

"Wait...don't I already do that? I have a first person view here." Haruka was confused.

"No no M'lady you misunderstand." Leumya stood up as her white qi pao fulttered in the soft breeze as her black heels dug into the ground. "You'll have to trust me on this however..."

Haruka rarely trusted anyone due to being seen as a freak. But Leumya...she felt somewhat comfortible with, despite being afraid. Leumya held out her hand as the wall opened up to allow her hand to fit inside the room.

14.content:
In the far future of the year 2050 humanity has made great scientific progress in the fields of artificial intelligence, robotics, physics and weaponry The Human race was experiencing a new golden age of technology, that was until They came. On December the 1st 2050 an unknown object entered the earth's orbit. Upon first inspection, NASA concluded that this was a meteorite comprised of a previously unknown material, furthermore they calculated it's trajectory and discovered that it would land in the United States, specifically West Virginia. After the area is evacuated the meteorite lands, completely eradicating everything in a 40 mile radius around the point of impact. After several hours the meteorite cracked in two revealing a gigantic alien creature. It was oddly human, but at the same time it had features from other earthly animals ( imagine something along the lines of a monster girl).

All attempts to communicate failed as anyone who got close was swiftly destroyed by the creature. Then the alien started making a B line to New York city. The giant beast was eventually subdued halfway through, but not before she trampled several smaller cities on her way. The world was cheering at their victory, but it wouldn't last for long as NASA soon discovered that a large number of very similar meteorites were heading toward earth. Several scientists at the U.N. decided that the best way to fight giant half monster/half girl monsters from space is to create their own giant half robot/half girl protectors. And so, the U.N. and the worlds largest companies scrambled to each create a mecha giantess. Such companies are:

Über corp.
Base of operations: Germany
Aesthetic: Industrial, bulky with a strong emphasis on efficiency. Large yellow plates with many cables and hydraulics showing in between.
The colossal Über corp international is the leading producer of heavy duty mining equipment. Their motto is "Bigger is better", that school of thought is best seen in their marketing campaign. They promise the public that their mecha giantess will be so large that she will dwarf the alien invaders. Of course great size alone is often not enough to win a confrontation, and if the giantess is really as large as they advertise she might just cause more collateral damage that the aliens she fights.

Hemtec
Base of operations: the U.S.A.
Aesthetics: Sleek, and white texture. Large emphasis of prettiness and flair instead of function.
Once a pioneer in the information industry, Hemtec has started to emphasize on looks rather than function in the recent decades. In order to boost their sales even more they declared that they would be manufacturing their own mecha giantess. Hemtec has guaranteed to make her their most stylistically appealing and innovative product yet. While she might be frail, Hemtec has access to some of the most advanced weapon systems and AI in the world, which they states is enough to even out the odds.

Koloss

5 months after initial contact with the aliens.

In the Über corp. HQ, a man by the name of Jonas Morgenstern was preparing for an interview. The young representative of Über corp. had arranged an interview with a journalist affiliated with one of the largest news companies in Germany. The subject being the newly constructed Mecha Giantess. Right now he is talking to his superior via phone.

"Remember Klaus, you must answer truthfully but you must not share exact information, no exact heights, exact weight or exact materials. Be vague, but not too much. After all people will be less hyped to see it her action if they already know everything about her." said the voice on the phone.

"Yes, yes don't worry. I've been practicing the entire week for this. I promise i won't completely blow it. " Klaus said jokingly. A few knocks were heard and Klaus then said "Gotta cut your lecture short, the interviewer is coming in".

The young man fixed his tie, put on his best confident face, cleared his throat and he finally told his guest to enter. The woman that entered was dressed smartly and carried a small notebook.

"it's a pleasure to meet you in person Mr. Klaus, I'm Julia and i'll be asking you a few question regarding Über corp.'s newest project." the woman said as she took a seat.

"It's nice to meet you too Julia. Now let's not waste time and begin the interview." Klaus said.

"Very well. First question, How do you plan to call her?" Julia asked.

"Her official name is Anna, named after the CEO of Über corp.'s daughter" Klaus said.

" Question number two, your company promised to make the Mecha Giantess truly colossal, to quote your CEO "So massive that she will dwarf the invaders. Is that the case and exactly how big is she?" Julia asked.

"Well Julia i'm sorry to disapoint you but i'm not allowed to discuss the exact size but i can explain it to you. You know that monster that landed in the U.S.A. 5 moths ago? Well Anna will be much bigger." He answered.

"Question number three, What kind of weapons will she have?" the woman asked

"You see, Germany has very tight weapon control, we could get the permit if we wanted but it would take at least two years and we need her ready and operational asap. We managed to find a way to bypass this problem. Giant robotic arms to matter how heavy or fist like do not count as weapons but as mining equipment, for which we've had a permit ever since the company's creation. It might seem inefficient but we've hired the best martial artists in the world to help program the ultimate fighting AI." Klaus answered.

"I guess i should also mention that we built in several large pieces of mining equipment onto her. This is in order to improve her overall usefulness." he added.

"I see. Question number four. Can you share any pictures of Anna?" the reporter asked.

Klaus sat there for a moment, thinking out his next move. His superior told him to not share exact information, to be vague but not too much. Well he did leave the exact level of vagueness to Klaus so... to hell with it. Klaus had some pictures of her laying around that would make for some great newspaper material, his boss would be angry but the risk would be worth it.

"Actually i have some pictures of Anna over here." the young man said, as he opened his drawer. he picked up a few photos and he presented them to Julia.

On all of the photos there were some people, trucks and other equipment that made it easier to imagine just how colossal she was. The humans alone looked like ants compared to her towering metal body. ( she looks something like this "http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/264/317/962.jpg")

"I appreciate the risk that you're taking Mr. Klaus. One last question, when should we expect her to make her public appearance?" she asked.

"She should be ready by next month." Klaus said

"Thank you for your input Mr. Klaus. It was a pleasure to work with you." Julia said as she got up from the chair.

"The pleasure was all mine Julia." Klaus said

The report and the pictures served to greatly boost Über corp.'s popularity. Klaus did receive a very stern talk from his superior for disobeying orders, but he did receive a raise in the end. A moth later Anna made her appearance.

What did she do then?

143.content:
5 months after contact with the alien giantesses.

In a top secret laboratory, deep underground somewhere in the Siberian tundra, Viktor Asimov former world renowned scientist, now the CEO of Koloss was now finalizing his "Mecha Giantess" project. On that exact day, the president of Russia ordered an inspection of the facility and the giantess. The inspector was no other than Leonid Krakov, Senior Lieutenant and close friend of the president. Right now these two influential men were taking an elevator to the deepest part of the facility, where in a large hangar the giantess herself was being stored. The eerie silence accompanied by the mechanical noises from the elevators were interrupted by the Lieutenant.

"The rest of the facility is in tip-top shape Asimov, But i am yet to see the main attraction." said Leonid.

"Why thank you Lieutenant. Things have been going quite smoothly, we were planning to be finished in 8 moths but it seems that we underestimated the funding we would receive." the scientist noted.

"I hope that this speed didn't come at the cost of quality, after all Mother Russia is counting on you to defend her. This is a great honor and no expenses should be spared, be it armor, weapons or the AI." said the Lieutenant.

"I'm sorry to say this but i might have to disappoint you a little, Lieutenant. You see when we were installing the AI we left most memories almost completely blank. Sure she might reason and act like an adult but she still has a lot to learn about this world and humanity in general." said Asimov.

"May i remind you that you're making a weapon, not some oversized child" said Leonid in a stern and disapproving manner."I just hope that it was worth it to severely damage all of our international relations for her." he sighted.

"Don't worry Lieutenant, She is very prepared to defend the motherland, you'll see." said Asimov, trying to reassure Leonid.

After a few more silent minutes the elevator finally stopped at the deepest level. The doors of the elevator creaked open, revealing a large brightly lit room. The room was filled with bustling scientist and engineers who were running test and conducting last minute checks. But in the piddle of the giant room on a large podium like structure stood the giantess. She was monstrously large, almost touching the ceiling of the room. Her body was like that of a human, her head had long hair and her face was gorgeous. Her hand were a stark contrast to her womanly body, they were akin to large metal gauntlets: bulky, army green in color with a large red star in the middle, ready to deliver punishing blows to the aliens that dared to attack the motherland. Her legs resembled her arms in design: Again Army green but with the Russian coat of arms imprinted on the kneecaps. She was truly a sight to behold and the Lieutenant would agree, were he not busy staring in awe.

"She's... She's beautiful!" said Leonid trying not to tear up.

"I'm glad you like her Lieutenant, but i'm afraid you haven't seen the best part yet. Do you notice the small cracks on her entire body? Those aren't defects, those are panels. During combat they are going to fly open, revealing dozens of tucked away heavy ordinance: machine guns, missiles, cannons anything you can imagine." Asimov declared proudly.

In a fit of sheer joy and pride the stoic Lieutenant delivered a tight hug to Asimov.
"The moment this beauty sets foot on the surface, those damn Yankees will turn red in shame!" cheered the Lieutenant as he squeezed the scientist.

"Yes that appears to be so... but uh... you're crushing me..." said Asimov. Leonid immediately came back to his senses, he recoiled backwards and tried to adopt a more professional expression.

"Please excuse me Asimov. I will report back to the president now. I'm sure he'll be just as happy as i am." said Leonid

"It was an honor to have you as a guest. Send my best regards to the president" said Asimov.

"Oh, i almost forgot to ask. She has a name right?" asked the Lieutenant.

"Well her official name is VDF-37 but i have programmed her to respond to the name "Katyusha" answered the Scientist.

And with that both men headed in different directions. The Lieutenant headed to the elevator but Asimov headed toward the giantess in order to finalize the project and turn her power on for the first time...
